Subject: Re: Creep's Operation - Bushido Base [Celeron, Creep, Kratos]
X-Yahoo-Group-Post: member; u=197581214; y=BdrfY-2QMsB1K0-7Om38ZZksTzYd2QAWbFAWjfohjnqHaZs

"Of course." he replied, stopping his work.  "I have discovered that
someone has tampered with your system.  You are constantly being
drained of energy and need to feast on sparks.... until now.   I have
developed a way to recharge you without the unfortunate consequences
of killing and eating useful subordinate."

He stood up and came to the table she was sitting on.

"This is only a permenant solution, but it will give me time to figure
out how to reverse these perverse structural modifications to your
system.    How do you feel?"

On 1/12/08, Nic <warriorazure@...> wrote:
> Creep looked at Celeron in a wat that said
> just-what-are-you-talking-about.
>
> Creep: Of course I know you Celeron. Now what's going on there? Cure
> me of what?
>
> --- In nbwrpg@yahoogroups.com, Kraftlos <kraftlos@...> wrote:
> >
> > The troopers knew what this bot was capable of and twitched with
> > anticipation.  Celeron held up his hand, motioning for them to wait
> > before reacting too harshly.
> >
> > "Hello my dear.  Do you remember who I am?" he said, in an
> > uncharacteristically familiar tone.  "You suffered a sudden energon
> > shock and went into stasis lock.  I brought you here and have found a
> > way to, how do I put this, re-animate you."
> >
> > He hit a few keys on the computer and saved the data from this
> > successful experiment.
> >
> > "Now to cure you of your insatiable hunger..." he wispered to himself
> > as he sat down at the computer and began typing.   The troopers,
> > feeling at ease, lowered their weapons and looked at eachother, unsure
> > of their orders.
> >
> > On 1/10/08, Nic <warriorazure@...> wrote:
> > > The energy surge coursed through Creep's circuits, waking her. The
> > > sparklust was not in her eyes this time. She blinked a bit and tried
> > > to get her bearings.
> > >
> > > Creep: What the... where am I?
> > >
> > > --- In nbwrpg@yahoogroups.com, Kraftlos <kraftlos@> wrote:
> > > >
> > > > After a few megacycles, the troopers had collected sufficient
> > > amounts of raw
> > > > energon.  After he had completed the refinement process, he prepared
> > > some
> > > > cables to charge up Creep's core.
> > > >
> > > > The troopers wheeled in the stasis pod and with several extra
> guards he
> > > > opened the pod, assuming that Creep would remain inactive, as she
> > > had very
> > > > little energy left.  He attached the charger to Creep's spark
> casing.
> > > >
> > > > "CLEAR!" shouted Celeron as the massive burst of energon ripped
> down the
> > > > wires and into Creep.
> > > >
> > > > OOC:  Its up to you whether this works or not.   This stage is just
> > > > attempting to re-charge creep without her having to eat sparks.
>  Celeron
> > > > will probably want her back in stasis even if this stage is
> successful,
> > > > because he wants to attempt to repair the additional circuitry which
> > > makes
> > > > her have to feed on sparks.
> > > >
> > > > On Dec 3, 2007 6:16 PM, Nic <warriorazure@> wrote:
> > > >
> > > > >   OOC: Celeron will definitely find hints that Creep has been
> tampered
> > > > > with and has deliberately been made as a vampire. He will also see
> > > > > that the spark eating process allows her to use almost any
> > > > > transformation on her body. PM to my hotmail address if you
> want to
> > > > > set anything specific for her.
> > > > >
> > > > >
> > > > > --- In nbwrpg@yahoogroups.com <nbwrpg%40yahoogroups.com>, Kraftlos
> > > > > <kraftlos@> wrote:
> > > > > >
> > > > > > The trooper arrived shortly with his data from the hospital.
> > > > > Obviously he
> > > > > > had some trouble getting the data as all the doctors that
> had been
> > > > > treating
> > > > > > Creep had had their sparks torn from their chests and eaten.
> > > > > Celeron, while
> > > > > > annoyed by the delay, was very appreciative of the delay.
> > > > > >
> > > > > > After viewing the data, he came to the realization that
> there was
> > > > > some sort
> > > > > > of containment leak within her spark which caused energon to
> flow
> > > > > out of her
> > > > > > system. Under normal circumstances, a transformer's spark would
> > > > > merely be
> > > > > > extinguished after its energy dropped to a level where the spark
> > > > > could no
> > > > > > longer maintain cohesion. However it appeared that someone had
> > > > > > intentionally routed an energy conduit directly from her
> mouth right
> > > > > into a
> > > > > > battery-like object next to her spark; allowing her to feast on
> > > other's
> > > > > > sparks to keep her own intact.
> > > > > >
> > > > > > Whether this had been done as a temporary measure to keep
> her alive,
> > > > > or as a
> > > > > > means to make her kill, and kill often; the Bushido Predecons
> > > couldn't
> > > > > > sustain her needs for energy even if they emptied all the
> > > prisons in the
> > > > > > Valley Mine Pentatron. Celeron estimated that she would have had
> > > to eat
> > > > > > approximately one spark every two days and that the battery
> could
> > > > > sustain a
> > > > > > charge of at least 4 sparks, giving her a little over a week or
> > > > > about 200
> > > > > > megacycles to roam before needing to kill again.
> > > > > >
> > > > > > *From the data, he determined two things:*
> > > > > > 1. He would first need to generation some sort of substitute
> energon
> > > > > power
> > > > > > to feed into her spark so she wouldn't need to eat other
> people's
> > > > > sparks and
> > > > > > he could keep her well-fed while he tried to come up with a
> > > solution.
> > > > > > 2. He would eventually need to figure out where this leak
> was and
> > > > > repair it;
> > > > > > then finally removing the conduits that allowed her to eat
> > > sparks in the
> > > > > > first place.
> > > > > >
> > > > > > He had never done surgery, but it didn't really bother him
> that he
> > > > > would be
> > > > > > working on a living being. Perhaps he might even have the time
> > > to make
> > > > > > some, "enhancements" to her design, that is, if Kratos would let
> > > > > him. He
> > > > > > typed up all this data and sent it to Kratos.
> > > > > >
> > > > > > "Celeron to Kratos, I have determined that I need to perform
> surgery
> > > > > on our
> > > > > > hungry friend. I wanted to make sure that it was alright if I
> > > > > operated on
> > > > > > her. I am sending a report to you now," he said, realizing
> that he
> > > > > probably
> > > > > > didn't really need permission to do anything, but he always
> thought
> > > > > it wise
> > > > > > to respect the leader. "Also, I was wondering if you would be
> > > > > interested in
> > > > > > me adding some devices and weapons to her frame after I
> correct the
> > > > > problem
> > > > > > with her spark.
> > > > > >
> > > > > >
> > > > > >
> > > > > >
> > > > > >
> > > > > > On Dec 2, 2007 5:56 PM, Nic <warriorazure@> wrote:
> > > > > >
> > > > > > > Creep was still. The stasis worked on her, keeping her
> inactive.
> > > > > > >
> > > > > > > OOC: Celeron can go ahead and work his magic.
> > > > > > >
> > > > > > >
> > > > > > > --- In nbwrpg@yahoogroups.com
> > > <nbwrpg%40yahoogroups.com><nbwrpg%40yahoogroups.com>, Kraftlos
> > > > >
> > > > > > > <kraftlos@> wrote:
> > > > > > > >
> > > > > > > > Celeron arrived in his lab and checked to see that no
> one had
> > > > > been in
> > > > > > > > there while he was gone. He sat down at the work bench and
> > > turned on
> > > > > > > > a computer. He need to get the data from the hospital;
> clearly
> > > > > > > > everyone
> > > > > > > > involved in the incident, save a few assistants, had been
> > > > > devoured by
> > > > > > > > Creep; so he would need to send over a trooper to
> collect all
> > > > > the data
> > > > > > > > and bring it here.
> > > > > > > >
> > > > > > > > "Trooper," he said into the communication panel. "I need
> you to
> > > > > fetch
> > > > > > > > me some data, i'm sending instructions to your terminal."
> > > > > > > >
> > > > > > > > "As you command..."
> > > > > > > >
> > > > > > > > Celeron set down his energon gun and opened a hatch on the
> > > back. He
> > > > > > > > pulled out a memory chip and placed it in his computer
> terminal.
> > > > > > > >
> > > > > > > > OOC: Rhinox was last posted for inside the base, but I
> > > havent heard
> > > > > > > > from him in a while. What's up?
> > > > > > >
> > > > > > >
> > > > > > >
> > > > > >
> > > > >
> > > > >
> > > > >
> > > >
> > >
> > >
> > >
> >
>
>
>
